comments.commentBody: Man, this can backfire. This is how I got stuck with an insane stepmother. They dying shouldn't have such a strong voice.

He must be a great guy and you also have to be fabulous. I tell my daughter in laws all the time my sons are who they are because of them. May you find peace knowing that your husband and you have found the best of this world. God bless your family.
I believe you may have missed the point!!!

Amy,  I woke up this morning , opened up news online and read your article. I still can't stop crying . You are so brave and definitely an inspiration to others.  I recently lost my only sister at 45 from uterine cancer. I will pray that the ending to this story will change and you and your husband will continue your beautiful relationship!

How  Beautiful and so loving of a wife you are. So touched by your  words, I lost my mother to cancer at 20 years old. New baby born and no mom to turn to.  I understand the love and compassion that you are experiencing. I wish the absolute best for your husband, you speak so lovingly and proud of him. I only wish I could have it man of that level. My prayers are with you and your family. Big hugs

This may be the case if  Medicare expansion was not blocked by Republicans in many states. But you also misunderstand what your party is trying to do. They are trying to prevent any medical care provider that has even a tacit connection to abortion services (which are constitutionally legal) from getting paid by Medicare. There is no logical nor actual evidence that this is an effective thing to do for the health and wellness of families and children. But--despite all factual truth to the contrary they persist because of some muddled religious impetus. These sorts of religious-based legislative actions that defy any reason or factual basis are exactly why the founders thought that religion and government stewed together create a toxic brew.

So beautiful, so poignant. I'm a straight male half his age and I want to marry Jason. May he carry your love and hope in his heart for 9,490 more days. While we can't live forever, our love can and does. Your love for Jason and his love for you will too.

Thank you for sharing your story.

P.S. Do you think Jason would mind running for POTUS in 2020? He sure does sound like a godsend in more ways than one.

God bless you Amy. I am speechless.
U will survive.
You, not Amy, make me so sad.

Sharing this singles ad with whomever cares to take a closer look.  What a beautiful day of wisdom and maturity this is, where we can have this kind of conversation.  AKR... thank you, and all the best. <3
Thank you for sharing your story of love with us. May you be well, may you be happy and safe, may you be free of suffering and the causes of suffering, may you be filled with lovingkindness.

I do wish the press and pundits would take Jon Stewart's advice and take up a hobby: journalism - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cmdFne7LnuA - skip to minute 7 if you have little time. It would begin with observing that amplifying Trump's absence of thought and conscience is not helping. He doesn't have a plan, except to aggrandize himself and hurt everyone who has ever noticed and mentioned that he is an empty selfish shell; he doesn't have a conscience or ethics. He steals from the poor and gives to the rich; kleptocrats are more useful to him.

Don't take his tweets seriously; don't report them as "news". They're the adolescent insults of a guy who never achieved full humanity in his life.

His genius is for advertising, and since he doesn't connect consequences to actions, he makes it up as he goes along. How many times has he turned meaning inside out and upside down, just to get even? He's a playground bully, grown up and given immense power. But no power will ever be enough for him, and he takes it for granted that being president allows him to do and say as he pleases.

He doesn't care about you. He cares about himself. He takes advice from the worst because he's pushed away all the good people. He has no idea that the harm he encourages - Bannon, the Kochs, enabling Congress - is dangerous to all of us, and if he did, he wouldn't care. He just wants what he wants and has no idea that he is entirely empty of value or meaning.
A wonderfully pithy, elegant, and terrifying summary of the 45th President.

It's not about abortion. It's about a fundamental misogyny that sees women who are unapologetically sexually active as dirty and not deserving of government services.   This standard is never applied to men.  It would be nice if there were campaigns for greater condom use, but since the beneficiaries would primarily be women, it never happens.

If contraceptives and sterilization services are an essential element of women's health care, why is it that vasectomies are not an essential element of men's health care?  Why is it that a woman gets her tubes tied for free and men don't?
ebmem: contrary to your assertion, men's vasectomies - and VIAGRA and prostate and testicular cancer screenings- are covered by the ACA and insurance.

The problem with pinning the problems on Trump is that the Republicans have been trafficking in and benefitting from an alternative reality for decades - whether it was Clinton Derangement Syndrome, or denying the problems in Iraq, global warming, the need for regulations. or the supposed horrors of illegal immigrants. Trump was elected because he seemed to be the only candidate who was willing to act on this version of reality. Mistrust of the MSM, scientists, and people who actually know stuff (the intellectual elite) didn't start with Trump and won't end with him, unless people experience negative consequences, unless perhaps enough purveyors of the alternative reality are willing to admit that they were wrong/lying.  As long as the Republican leadership and Fox News continue to support Trump, it probably doesn't matter how the press reacts.

And an example of one not willing to admit they were wrong/lying is Glenn Beck. He seems to be critical of Trump without taking credit for the fact that he (Beck) was one of those who created this monster.
If I were Melania, I'd stay in New York, too.
Exactly.  And she is shielding her child from him as well.

We’re seeing Ross Douthat’s “immodest proposals” from more people, including Roger Cohen. And it seems to be ginned up by reflexive resistance to Trump. More people have become SO fed up at American degeneration yet so frightened of HIM, that for the first time in ages we’re hearing ideas about how to tackle challenges that might be essayed WITHOUT him yet still address the historical reasons that summoned him. Even when the proposals are “immodest”.

Good for Trump, even in a distaff way (and good for Ross and Roger). There’s nothing more American than refusing to be beaten down and insisting that there be some way to come back.

An energized program of national service would be expensive, but there would be few things more unifying to our unemployed young and healthier in the long run than a program that created valuable things, taught our young useful skills while making them productive – and qualifying for serious help with higher education. Indeed, from such a program could come PART of an approach to strategically addressing the accelerating problem of automation obsolescing traditional human labor and the economic model of wages for work that generates corporate profit.

I like Roger’s idea more than Ross’s two, so far; but the ultimate value isn’t a specific idea but the willingness to dare to offer them. If provides us with grist for a problem-solving mill, and some actually may capture the imagination of Congress AND Trump. And, in the end, some could work.

Point taken that with Trump as a shock to the system, "... for the first time in ages we’re hearing ideas about how to tackle challenges that might be essayed WITHOUT him yet still address the historical reasons that summoned him."

In defense of us all I'll mention two things.

First, we live in changing, dizzying times for fundamental matters such as the nature of work and family. That sort of change takes more than a lifetime to resolve, leaving many adrift and unsettled during their one lifetime. It's not so easy to find our footing on such issues.

Second, the way we all come together to hash certain things out in a democracy is politics. Many people who have had the most electoral success for some time have been those who foment divisions. If we don't learn how to reward competent bridge builders and oppose those who foment division with our votes, ideas involving government will ultimately lead nowhere.

But I suppose this last is an old problem. How do we get to a critical mass of people willing to act in our common interest to solve those problems we have in common without finding, or inventing, a common enemy to oppose?

On issues where we're almost equally divided, or adrift, I don't see one side peacefully imposing a lasting solution on the other. Continued domestic strife has unintended consequences. Leaving problems unaddressed has predictable consequences.

Interesting that so many older people want younger people to give up a year of their lives, at much less than minimum wage. For what? To be compelled by maudlin hucksters to embrace a false patriotism?

I am pleasantly surprised that you and I agree on two things now:

Your comment yesterday about healthcare in this country was right on the money! We need a system similar to what every other advanced nation has, something akin to single payer for everyone from birth. And yes, we do have one just like that already but it's only for senior citizens and the disabled. It's called Medicare and it's worked well for over a half century.

As for Roger's idea for an expanded national service system, I couldn't agree more.! It would solve several problems at once, not least young people learning empathy and communication skills but also help pay for higher education.

However (and I should capitalize the word), to think that someone as intellectually incurious and emotionally stunted as Trump could even digest this idea and run with it is ingenuous at best. And even more, he is in the presidential "cocoon" now surrounded by zealots who won't let ideas like this in (and he certainly won't hear about it on Fox News!). A double whammy!

"If the people of this country had enough discernment to detect a fraud when they saw one, he wouldn’t have been elected."

They DID detect an even more offensive fraud, which is how we were left with Trump. And it is Democrat's fault for offering even worse than Trump. Own it. You guys did this.

Yours is a common misconception--that Planned Parenthood funding is fungible, and therefore any government funding allows more money to be used for abortions.

PP funding is not fungible. A strict wall is erected between any kind of expense involving abortion and ordinary healthcare expenses, including facilities costs.
What beautiful words, so heartfelt. Amy, you are so special. You will be a tuff act to follow. I wish you and your family God's blessings.

Did you Actually read this before you made your negative commentary? It clearly states he works 9-5 at a law office, so most probably a lawyer...really read something next time before you say anything...thanks!!

Ms. Rosenthal,

You will live on in your children, your husband and your friends. You have left such an endearing example of your love that people will never forget you.

It is not the sickness that defines us, it is the people whom we have touched with our words and actions. Peace be with you.

Dearest Amy,
We don't know one another and never will. I understand completely your sentiment: My husband -- my beshert -- lost his battle with cancer more than 20 years ago, when our kids were very little; one of them doesn't remember him at all. At the time, once he had accepted that he was dying, he said he needed to find me a husband and pointed me toward one of his best friends whom he trusted implicitly. We never went that route. The friend said it would be like kissing your sister, and he was right, it would have seemed like that!
Grace and peace to you, your husband and your children. I don't know what else to say except to tell you that those who love you will never forget you. Have a safe journey.
What a beautiful legacy. What love. I'm sorry you must leave this world. Thank you so much for sharing your lovely thoughts.
Believe.
I will think of you when you are in heaven,will you please send us your blessings? Thank you.
